skill.name: subagent-driven-development
skill.description: Use when executing implementation plans with independent tasks in the current session
skill.summary: Use when executing implementation plans with independent tasks in the current session
skill.author: davila7

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based workflow orchestration skill containing only markdown documentation and AI agent templates. No executable code, scripts, network calls, or file system access. All static findings are false positives: markdown code blocks misclassified as shell execution, Git terminology flagged as crypto, and code review questions flagged as reconnaissance.

content.value_statement: Managing multiple subagents manually creates context pollution and inconsistent quality. This skill dispatches fresh subagents per task with automated two-stage review checkpoints, ensuring spec compliance before code quality review.
actual_capabilities: Dispatches fresh implementer subagent per task to avoid context pollution
Runs spec compliance review to verify implementation matches requirements
Performs code quality review to ensure clean, maintainable code
Supports iterative review loops until both reviews pass
Tracks task completion in TodoWrite for progress visibility
Uses two-stage gating: spec compliance before quality review
limitations: Requires pre-defined implementation plan with clear tasks
Tasks must be mostly independent to avoid conflicts
Needs to stay in same session for context continuity
Does not handle tightly coupled tasks between subagents

use_cases.title: Manage complex feature implementations
use_cases.description: Coordinate multi-part features where tasks can be implemented independently with quality gates between each

use_cases.title: Scale code review processes
use_cases.description: Automate spec verification and code quality checks across multiple concurrent implementation tasks

use_cases.title: Build reliable agent systems
use_cases.description: Create production workflows where each subagent task gets validated before proceeding to next

prompt_templates.title: Simple task dispatch
prompt_templates.prompt: Use Subagent-Driven Development to implement: [describe task]. The work dir is [path]. Start by asking any clarifying questions.

prompt_templates.title: Multi-task execution
prompt_templates.prompt: Use Subagent-Driven Development to execute this plan. [Paste plan text]. Extract all tasks and dispatch implementer subagents with full context.

prompt_templates.title: Review checkpoint
prompt_templates.prompt: Spec reviewer found issues: [list]. Dispatch implementer subagent to fix each issue, then re-run spec compliance and quality reviews.

prompt_templates.title: Final review integration
prompt_templates.scenario: Complete all tasks with final review
prompt_templates.prompt: All tasks complete. Dispatch final code reviewer subagent for entire implementation, then use finishing-a-development-branch to merge.

output_examples.input: Use Subagent-Driven Development to add user authentication to the API. Plan is in docs/plans/auth.md
output: Task 1: User model and database schema
â†’ Implementer: Questions about password hashing approach
â†’ You: Use bcrypt with cost 12
â†’ Implementer: Implemented, tests passing, committed
â†’ Spec reviewer: Pass - all requirements met
â†’ Code reviewer: Pass - clean code
â†’ Task 2: Login endpoint with JWT...

best_practices: Provide full task text to subagent instead of making them read files
Answer all subagent questions before letting them proceed
Never skip review checkpoints even if implementation seems correct
Require re-review after every fix - reviewer must approve again
anti_patterns: Skipping spec compliance review to save time
Running code quality review before spec compliance passes
Letting implementer skip self-review before reporting

faq.question: What is the difference between this skill and executing-plans?
faq.answer: This skill keeps execution in the same session for continuous progress. Executing-plans creates parallel sessions with context switches.

faq.question: Can I dispatch multiple implementer subagents in parallel?
faq.answer: No. Parallel dispatch causes conflicts and context pollution. Tasks must be independent AND sequential in this workflow.

faq.question: What if a subagent asks questions during implementation?
faq.answer: Answer all questions completely before letting them continue. Never rush past clarification points.

faq.question: How does this skill protect against bad implementations?
faq.answer: Two-stage review catches issues. Spec review verifies requirements are met. Code quality review ensures maintainability. Re-review loops verify fixes.

faq.question: What happens when a reviewer finds issues?
faq.answer: Same implementer subagent fixes issues. Then re-review runs. Loop continues until both spec and quality reviews pass.

faq.question: What skills should I combine with this workflow?
faq.answer: Use writing-plans before to create plans. Use finishing-a-development-branch after all tasks complete. Subagents should use test-driven-development.
